TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DocumentPage extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a document page produced by a paginator.

Docs.param: The visual representation of the page.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified .

MemberSignature.Value: public DocumentPage (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, System.Windows.Size pageSize, System.Windows.Rect bleedBox, System.Windows.Rect contentBox);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, valuetype System.Windows.Size pageSize, valuetype System.Windows.Rect bleedBox, valuetype System.Windows.Rect contentBox) cil managed

Docs.param: The visual representation of the page.
The size of the page, including margins, as it will be after any cropping.
The area for print production-related bleeds, registration marks, and crop marks that may appear on the physical sheet outside the logical page boundaries.
The area of the page within the margins.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified and box sizes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `bleedBox` dimensions may be greater than the `pageSize` dimensions when it is expected that the physical sheets will be cropped to their final page size.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the area for print production-related bleeds, registration marks, and crop marks that may appear on the physical sheet outside the logical page boundaries.
Docs.value: A representing the size and location of the bleed box area.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The bleed box will extend outside the page when it is expected that the physical sheets will be cropped to their final page size.
Use the protected <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.SetBleedBox%2A> method to set this property.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the area of the page within the margins.
Docs.value: A representing the area of the page, not including the margins.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the protected <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.SetContentBox%2A> method to set this property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage>. The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage> in an unusable state. After calling <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Dispose%2A> you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage> was occupying. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage> object's `Finalize` method.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage Missing

Docs.summary: Represents a missing page. This property is static and read only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Return the value <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Missing?displayProperty=fullName> when calling code requests a page that does not exist; for example, page 2 of a one-page document.
There is always just one missing page object. Its <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Visual%2A> property is `null`. Its <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.Size%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.BleedBox%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.ContentBox%2A> properties are all set to special "empty" values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void OnPageDestroyed(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the that depicts the is destroyed and can no longer be used for display.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void SetBleedBox(valuetype System.Windows.Rect bleedBox) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that specifies the size and location of a rectangle.
Docs.summary: Sets the dimensions and location of the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The bleed box includes material, such as crop marks, that are not necessarily included in the final, post-cropping, physical page. For this reason, the <xref:System.Windows.Rect.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Y%2A> coordinates of the `bleedBox` parameter can be negative numbers, because they are specified as relative to the upper left corner of the page. For the same reason, the <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Width%2A> of `bleedBox` can be greater than the height and width of the page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void SetContentBox(valuetype System.Windows.Rect contentBox) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that specifies the size and location of a rectangle.
Docs.summary: Sets the dimension and location of the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void SetSize(valuetype System.Windows.Size size) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the of the physical page as it will be after any cropping.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void SetVisual(class System.Windows.Media.Visual visual) cil managed

Docs.param: The visual representation of the page.
Docs.summary: Sets the that depicts the page.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the actual size of a page as it will be following any cropping.
Docs.value: A representing the height and width of the page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the post-cropping size of the physical page. Hence, it is not necessarily the physical size of the sheets before they are cropped.
Use the protected <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.SetSize%2A> method to set this property.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the visual representation of the page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the protected <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage.SetVisual%2A> method to set this property.
